properties.name: Oporto Almacén
properties.location:
11 de Septiembre de 1888 4152
C1429BJB Cdad. Autónoma de Buenos Aires
Argentina
properties.description: Oporto Almacén is a distinctive dining establishment in Buenos Aires, known for its Argentinian cuisine. The restaurant offers a cozy and inviting atmosphere, reflecting the rich culinary traditions of Argentina. Guests can enjoy a variety of dishes that highlight local ingredients and flavors, including expertly prepared meats and traditional sides. The restaurant's location in the vibrant city of Buenos Aires makes it a popular spot for both locals and visitors seeking an authentic taste of Argentina. Oporto Almacén is celebrated for its commitment to quality and its ability to provide a genuine dining experience.

properties.name: Besares Parrilla
properties.location:
11 de Septiembre de 1888 4098
C1429BIZ Cdad. Autónoma de Buenos Aires
Argentina
properties.description: Besares Parrilla is a renowned Argentine restaurant situated in the Nunez neighborhood of Buenos Aires. Established in 2009, it specializes in traditional Argentine barbecue, offering a variety of grilled meats such as molleja (sweetbreads), bife de chorizo (sirloin steak), vacio (flank steak), and lomo (tenderloin). The restaurant also serves a selection of homemade pastas and white meat dishes. The modern decor features an open, illuminated grill as the focal point of the dining area. Besares Parrilla is known for its generous portions and attentive service, making it a popular choice for both locals and visitors seeking an authentic Argentine dining experience.

properties.name: No Tan Santos
properties.location:
Nuñez 1650
C1429 Cdad. Autónoma de Buenos Aires
Argentina
properties.description: No Tan Santos Nunez is a cozy, rustic restaurant located at Nunez 1650 in Buenos Aires, Argentina. The establishment is renowned for its authentic Argentine parrilla, offering a variety of grilled meats such as bife de chorizo, entrana, and bondiola. The menu also includes empanadas, pastas, and salads, catering to diverse tastes. The charming garden area, adorned with string lights and surrounded by trees, provides a relaxed atmosphere for diners. The restaurant is pet-friendly, welcoming guests with their dogs. The interior features a modern and warm decor, enhancing the dining experience. The attentive staff contributes to the overall positive ambiance, making it a favored spot for both locals and visitors seeking a genuine Argentine culinary experience.

properties.name: Blest
properties.location:
Arribeños 3302
C1429 Cdad. Autónoma de Buenos Aires
Argentina

properties.name: Johnny B. Good - Al Río
properties.location:
Av. del Libertador 105
B1638 Vicente López, Provincia de Buenos Aires
Argentina

properties.name: Museo Sitio de Memoria ESMA
properties.location:
Av. del Libertador 8151 / 8571
C1429 BNB, Cdad. Autónoma de Buenos Aires
Argentina
properties.description: Museo Sitio de Memoria ESMA is a poignant museum and memorial dedicated to the victims of Argentina's Dirty War, a period of state terrorism from 1976 to 1983. The museum is housed in the former Navy School of Mechanics (ESMA), which served as a clandestine detention center where thousands were illegally detained, tortured, and disappeared. The site now serves as a powerful reminder of the past, with exhibits that include personal testimonies, photographs, and artifacts that document the human rights abuses committed during this dark chapter in Argentina's history. It stands as a testament to the resilience of the survivors and the importance of memory and justice.

properties.name: Museo Malvinas e Islas del Atlántico Sur
properties.location:
C. Santiago Calzadilla 1300
C1429 Cdad. Autónoma de Buenos Aires
Argentina
properties.description: The Museo Malvinas e Islas del Atlantico Sur, inaugurated on June 10, 2014, is dedicated to Argentina's sovereignty over the Falkland Islands and the South Atlantic. Located in the former Navy Mechanics School in Buenos Aires, the museum offers an interactive experience across three levels, featuring audiovisual displays, historical artifacts, and immersive exhibits. The exterior includes a relief map of the Falkland Islands and a silhouette of the ARA General Belgrano, commemorating the 1982 conflict. The museum is committed to accessibility, providing facilities for visitors with mobility challenges and offering multisensory experiences. (museomalvinas.cultura.gob.ar)

properties.name: Monumental Stadium
properties.location:
Av. Pres. Figueroa Alcorta 7597
C1428 Cdad. Autónoma de Buenos Aires
Argentina
properties.description: Monumental Stadium, officially named Estadio Antonio Vespucio Liberti, is the largest stadium in Argentina, located in Buenos Aires. It serves as the home ground for the River Plate football club and has a seating capacity of over 83,000 spectators. Opened in 1938, it has hosted numerous significant events, including the 1978 FIFA World Cup final. The stadium is renowned for its iconic architecture, with a distinctive facade and a breathtaking view of the playing field. Visitors often come to admire its historical value and the vibrant atmosphere during match days.

properties.name: Narda Comedor
properties.location:
Mariscal Antonio José De Sucre 664
Buenos Aires, C1428DUB
Argentina
properties.description: Narda Comedor, located at Mariscal Antonio Jose De Sucre 664 in Buenos Aires, is a restaurant led by renowned chef Narda Lepes. The establishment emphasizes healthy, vegetable-centric cuisine, offering a variety of dishes that highlight fresh, seasonal ingredients. The menu features options suitable for vegetarian, vegan, and gluten-free diets, though it also includes meat dishes like ossobuco. The spacious, white dining area with an open kitchen creates an inviting atmosphere. The restaurant operates throughout the day, serving breakfast, lunch, and dinner, accommodating various dining preferences.

properties.name: Belisario Roldán
properties.location:
Av. Pres. Figueroa Alcorta 5100
C1426 Cdad. Autónoma de Buenos Aires
Argentina
properties.description: Belisario Roldán is an Argentine restaurant situated within the Palermo Horse Riding Club in Buenos Aires. The establishment offers a rustic ambiance, allowing diners to experience traditional Argentine cuisine amidst a country setting in the city. The menu features a variety of grilled meats, including asado, and homemade pastas. The restaurant provides both indoor and outdoor seating, with the outdoor area offering views of the equestrian field. Accessibility features include wheelchair-friendly entrances and adapted parking. The venue is also known for hosting business meetings and events, providing a unique dining experience in the heart of Buenos Aires.

properties.name: Floralis Generica
properties.location:
Av. Figueroa Alcorta 2300
Buenos Aires
Argentina
properties.description: Floralis Generica is a striking sculpture located in Buenos Aires, Argentina, designed by Argentine architect Eduardo Catalano. This massive metal flower stands at 23 meters high and weighs 18 tons. It is made of stainless steel and aluminum, and its petals open and close with the sun, symbolizing the hope that is reborn every day. The sculpture is situated in the Plaza de las Naciones Unidas and is surrounded by beautiful gardens, making it a popular spot for both locals and tourists. The dynamic movement of the petals is powered by a hydraulic system and photoelectric cells, creating a unique and interactive experience.

properties.name: Jardín Japonés
properties.location:
Av. Casares 3450
C1425EWN C1425EWN, Cdad. Autónoma de Buenos Aires
Argentina
properties.description: Jardín Japonés, or the Japanese Garden, is a serene oasis located in Buenos Aires, Argentina. Spanning over 14 acres, this beautifully landscaped garden features a variety of plants, traditional Japanese architecture, and koi ponds. Opened in 1967, it serves as a cultural center for Japanese heritage, hosting various events and exhibitions. Visitors can stroll along winding paths, enjoy the tranquility of the lush surroundings, and discover elements of traditional Japanese landscaping, such as stone lanterns and bridges. The garden also houses a tea house where guests can experience Japanese tea ceremonies.

properties.name: Museo Sívori
properties.location:
Av. Infanta Isabel 555
C1425 Cdad. Autónoma de Buenos Aires
Argentina
properties.description: The Museo de Artes Plasticas Eduardo Sivori, established in 1938, is dedicated to Argentine art, particularly from the first half of the 20th century. Its collection comprises over 4,000 works, including paintings, engravings, drawings, and tapestries. Notable artists featured include Antonio Berni, Lucio Fontana, and Lino Enea Spilimbergo. The museum is housed in a building facing the Rosedal of Palermo, a prominent park in Buenos Aires. In addition to its permanent collection, the museum hosts temporary exhibitions and cultural activities. It also features a sculpture garden, a specialized library, and a cafe. (turismo.buenosaires.gob.ar)

properties.name: Museo de Arte Popular Jose Hernandez
properties.location:
Av. del Libertador 2373
C1425 Cdad. Autónoma de Buenos Aires
Argentina
properties.description: Museo de Arte Popular Jose Hernandez is a notable cultural institution nestled in Buenos Aires, dedicated to showcasing Argentine folk art from diverse regions of the country. Established with a mission to preserve and promote the craftsmanship and artistic expressions of local artisans, the museum features a rich collection that includes textiles, ceramics, and woodwork. Many exhibits highlight traditional crafts and contemporary works, providing insight into Argentina's cultural heritage. The museum not only serves as a gallery but also hosts workshops and educational programs, encouraging visitors to engage with the artistic processes.

properties.name: Casa Cavia
properties.location: Cavia 2985 Buenos Aires, C1425DDA Argentina
properties.description: Casa Cavia is a sophisticated establishment housed in a 1927 mansion in Buenos Aires' Palermo Chico neighborhood. The venue seamlessly blends a restaurant, bookstore, florist, perfumery, and publishing house under one roof. The restaurant, led by chef Julieta Caruso, offers a contemporary Argentine menu emphasizing local ingredients. The interior features high ceilings, ornate details, and a tranquil courtyard garden with a central water feature. The bar, managed by Ines de los Santos, serves innovative cocktails inspired by literature and music. The space also includes a flower shop and a perfumery, creating a unique cultural destination.

properties.name: Mishiguene
properties.location:
Lafinur 3368
Buenos Aires, C1425FAJ
Argentina
properties.description: Mishiguene is a celebrated restaurant in Buenos Aires that showcases the flavors of Jewish cuisine through a contemporary lens. Its warm and inviting atmosphere is complemented by a menu that features traditional dishes with modern twists, such as homemade challah and flavorful brisket. The decor pays homage to Jewish heritage, creating a cultural dining experience. Guests can expect a thoughtful selection of wines to pair with their meals, enhancing the overall culinary experience.

properties.name: Dandy
properties.location:
Av. del Libertador 2410
C1425 Cdad. Autónoma de Buenos Aires
Argentina
properties.description: Dandy is a restaurant situated at Av. del Libertador 2410 in Buenos Aires, Argentina. It offers a diverse menu featuring Argentinean and international dishes, including vegetarian options and delectable desserts. The establishment provides both indoor and outdoor seating, creating a cozy ambiance for diners. Patrons have praised the generous portions and the quality of the food. The restaurant is also known for its friendly and attentive staff, contributing to a pleasant dining experience.

properties.name: Croque Madame
properties.location:
Av. del Libertador 1902
C1425AAS Cdad. Autónoma de Buenos Aires
Argentina
properties.description: Croque Madame is a café situated within the Museo Nacional de Arte Decorativo in Buenos Aires, Argentina. It offers a variety of French-inspired dishes, including the classic Croque Madame sandwich, in a charming setting.

properties.name: Pizza Cero
properties.location:
Av. del Libertador 1800
C1112 ABP, Cdad. Autónoma de Buenos Aires
Argentina
properties.description: Pizza Cero is a renowned restaurant situated at the corner of Av. del Libertador and Tagle in Buenos Aires' Recoleta neighborhood. Celebrated for its artisanal stone-baked pizzas, the menu features over thirty varieties, including classics like Fugazzeta and innovative options such as the De la Huerta with sauteed vegetables and the Mexicana topped with spicy chicken and guacamole. The establishment also offers a diverse selection of dishes from Spanish, Italian, and Argentine cuisines, complemented by a sushi chef and a range of homemade pastries. The elegant interior boasts a high-ceilinged dining area with comfortable seating, while an outdoor terrace provides a pleasant setting overlooking the avenue's greenery. The bar serves a variety of classic and signature cocktails, enhancing the dining experience.

properties.name: Sottovoce
properties.location:
Avenida del Libertador 1098
Buenos Aires, C1112ABN
Argentina
properties.description: Sottovoce is an elegant Italian restaurant situated in the Recoleta neighborhood of Buenos Aires. The establishment offers a sophisticated dining experience, blending the charm of Italian cuisine with the ambiance of the city. The menu features a variety of dishes, including aubergine parmigiana, rotolo alla bolognese, black spaghetti with prawns, and homemade malfatti pasta filled with ricotta and spinach. The restaurant is divided into two floors, with a small terrace beneath the arches at the entrance. The interior is adorned with drawings by the late Miguel Brascó, a renowned Argentine writer and food critic who frequented the restaurant.

properties.name: Museo de Arte Hispanoamericano Isaac Fernández Blanco
properties.location:
Suipacha 1422
C1011 Cdad. Autónoma de Buenos Aires
Argentina
properties.description: The Museo de Arte Hispanoamericano Isaac Fernandez Blanco, located in the Retiro neighborhood of Buenos Aires, is renowned for its extensive collection of Spanish-American art. Housed in the neocolonial Palacio Noel, built in the 1920s by architect Martin Noel, the museum showcases artifacts from the colonial period, including silverwork, paintings, and religious imagery. The collection spans the 16th to 19th centuries, featuring pieces from the Cuzco and Potosi schools, as well as Mexican and Peruvian art. Notably, the museum boasts one of the largest collections of viceregal silverwork in South America. Visitors can also explore the museum's gardens, inspired by Spanish design, which host various cultural events throughout the year. (turismo.buenosaires.gob.ar)

properties.name: Elena
properties.location:
Posadas 1086/88
Buenos Aires, C1011ABB
Argentina
properties.description: Elena, situated in the Four Seasons Hotel Buenos Aires, is celebrated for its exquisite dry-aged steaks, premium seafood, and bold Argentine flavors. The restaurant offers an elegant yet vibrant setting, ideal for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. With an extensive wine selection and exceptional service, Elena seamlessly blends tradition with contemporary culinary artistry. Guests can indulge in signature cuts of beef, savor house-made charcuterie, or enjoy an intimate dining experience in the heart of Buenos Aires.

properties.name: Floreria Atlántico
properties.location:
Arroyo 872
C1007 Cdad. Autónoma de Buenos Aires
Argentina
properties.description: Florería Atlántico is a celebrated speakeasy-style bar situated at Arroyo 872 in Buenos Aires' Retiro district. Concealed behind a charming florist and wine shop, patrons enter through a discreet door leading to an intimate underground space. The bar's design evokes a ship's hold, adorned with maritime murals and nautical elements, creating a cozy ambiance. Founded in 2013 by bartender Renato "Tato" Giovannoni, it has been consistently ranked among The World's 50 Best Bars, securing the 3rd position in 2019. The cocktail menu pays homage to Argentina's immigrant heritage, featuring drinks inspired by countries such as Italy, Spain, France, Poland, and England. Each cocktail is crafted to reflect the flavors and traditions of these cultures, using both imported and local ingredients. The bar also offers a selection of tapas, emphasizing seafood and traditional dishes. Florería Atlántico provides a unique and immersive experience, blending history, culture, and gastronomy in a hidden gem of Buenos Aires.

properties.name: Gran Bar Danzon
properties.location:
Libertad 1161
C1012AAW Cdad. Autónoma de Buenos Aires
Argentina
properties.description: Gran Bar Danzon, established in 1998, is a sophisticated venue in Buenos Aires' Recoleta neighborhood, renowned for its extensive wine selection and innovative cocktails. The 12-meter illuminated bar serves as a focal point, offering a range of classic and contemporary drinks. The menu features contemporary Argentine cuisine, including sushi, ceviche, and dishes like confit de pato and risotto, crafted with high-quality ingredients. The establishment has been a training ground for many prominent figures in the local culinary and cocktail scene, contributing significantly to the city's gastronomic culture.

properties.name: Obelisco
properties.location:
Av. 9 de Julio s/n
C1043 Cdad. Autónoma de Buenos Aires
Argentina
properties.description: The Obelisco is an iconic structure located at the intersection of Avenida 9 de Julio and Avenida Corrientes in Buenos Aires, Argentina. Erected in 1936 to commemorate the 400th anniversary of the city's founding, the obelisk stands 67.5 meters tall and is one of the most recognizable landmarks in the city. Its design is simple yet striking, making it a popular gathering place and a focal point for various events and celebrations. The monument is surrounded by bustling streets and offers a vibrant urban atmosphere, attracting tourists and locals alike.

properties.name: Confitería Ideal
properties.location:
Suipacha 384
C1008AAF Cdad. Autónoma de Buenos Aires
Argentina
properties.description: Confitería Ideal, located at Suipacha 384 in Buenos Aires, is a historic café notable founded in 1912 by Spanish immigrant Manuel Rosendo Fernández. Designed by engineer C.F. González, the two-story building features opulent European-imported materials, including French chandeliers, Italian stained glass, and handcrafted oak boiserie. Over the years, it has been a gathering place for the city's elite and tango enthusiasts. After a significant restoration completed in 2022, the café reopened, preserving its original splendor. Today, it continues to serve as a cultural landmark, offering a glimpse into Buenos Aires' rich history.

properties.name: Plaza de Mayo
properties.location:
Av. Hipólito Yrigoyen s/n
C1087 Cdad. Autónoma de Buenos Aires
Argentina
properties.description: Plaza de Mayo is a historic square located in the heart of Buenos Aires, Argentina. Established in the colonial era, it serves as an important political and cultural site. The square is surrounded by notable buildings, including the Casa Rosada, the Metropolitan Cathedral, and the Cabildo. Over the years, it has been the stage for significant events in Argentine history, from revolutionary gatherings to contemporary protests. Visitors can appreciate its rich history while enjoying the vibrant atmosphere that surrounds this iconic landmark.

properties.name: Museo Nacional del Cabildo de Buenos Aires y de la Revolución de Mayo
properties.location:
Bolívar 65
C1066 Cdad. Autónoma de Buenos Aires
Argentina
properties.description: The Museo Nacional del Cabildo de Buenos Aires y de la Revolución de Mayo is housed in the historic Cabildo building, which was the seat of the colonial government during the Spanish rule. The museum offers a glimpse into Argentina's history, particularly focusing on the May Revolution of 1810, which was a pivotal event leading to the country's independence. Visitors can explore various exhibits showcasing artifacts, documents, and artworks from the colonial period. The building itself is an architectural gem, featuring colonial-style arches and a central courtyard, providing a unique historical ambiance.

properties.name: Museo Moderno
properties.location:
Av. San Juan 350
C1147 AAO, Cdad. Autónoma de Buenos Aires
Argentina
properties.description: Museo Moderno, formally known as the Museo de Arte Moderno de Buenos Aires, is a prominent contemporary art museum located in the capital city. Established in 1956, it houses an extensive collection of Argentine and international art, focusing on works from the 20th century to the present. The museum features both permanent and temporary exhibitions, showcasing painting, sculpture, and multimedia installations. Its modern architecture and design provide a fitting backdrop for the diverse artistic expressions on display, making it a must-visit for art enthusiasts.

properties.name: Parque Lezama
properties.location:
Av. Brasil
C1143 Cdad. Autónoma de Buenos Aires
Argentina
properties.description: Parque Lezama is a historic park located in the San Telmo neighborhood of Buenos Aires. It is adorned with beautiful gardens, century-old trees, and walking paths, making it a serene escape in the bustling city. The park features notable monuments and sculptures, including the iconic statue of the Argentine military leader, Manuel Belgrano. Parque Lezama is also home to cultural activities and events, attracting both locals and tourists. Its proximity to vibrant neighborhoods, art galleries, and restaurants enhances its appeal as a cherished leisure spot.

properties.name: Museo Histórico Nacional
properties.location:
Defensa 1600
C1143 Cdad. Autónoma de Buenos Aires
Argentina
properties.description: Museo Histórico Nacional, located in Buenos Aires, showcases the rich history of Argentina through its extensive collection of artifacts, documents, and exhibits. Housed in a grand building, the museum features displays that trace the country's evolution from pre-colonial times to the present day. Visitors can explore significant historical events and figures that shaped Argentina's national identity. The museum not only offers a glimpse into the past but also provides educational resources and activities for all ages, making it a vital cultural destination in the heart of the city.

properties.name: El Obrero
properties.location:
Agustín R. Caffarena 64
Cdad. Autónoma de Buenos Aires
Argentina
properties.description: El Obrero is a traditional Argentine restaurant situated at Agustín R. Caffarena 64 in Buenos Aires' La Boca neighborhood. Established in 1954, it has been serving classic Argentine dishes for decades. The restaurant's rustic decor features checkered tablecloths and walls adorned with sports memorabilia, creating a nostalgic atmosphere. The menu includes Argentine classics such as grilled steaks, sausages, milanesas, and empanadas. El Obrero has attracted both locals and international celebrities, including Robert De Niro and Bono. Its proximity to attractions like the Usina del Arte makes it a popular spot for both locals and tourists seeking an authentic Argentine dining experience.

properties.name: Usina del Arte
properties.location:
Agustín R. Caffarena 1
C1157 Cdad. Autónoma de Buenos Aires
Argentina
properties.description: Usina del Arte is a significant cultural center located in the heart of Buenos Aires. Originally an old electric power plant, it has been transformed into a vibrant space for art exhibitions, musical performances, and various cultural events. Featuring stunning architecture that blends industrial and contemporary designs, the venue hosts numerous festivals, concerts, and workshops throughout the year. Its spacious halls make it a popular destination for both locals and tourists seeking to experience the arts and culture of Buenos Aires.

properties.name: Costanera Sur
properties.location: Av. España 2330 Cdad. Autónoma de Buenos Aires Argentina
properties.description: Costanera Sur is a significant green space located along the banks of the Río de la Plata in Buenos Aires. This park features beautiful walking and cycling paths, lined with native trees and plants, offering a peaceful retreat from the city hustle. It's a popular destination for both locals and tourists, ideal for picnics, leisurely strolls, and enjoying scenic views of the waterfront. The area is also rich in biodiversity, serving as a haven for various bird species, making it a great spot for nature enthusiasts and photographers.

properties.name: Buque Museo Corbeta ARA Uruguay
properties.location:
C1107 Buenos Aires
Argentina
properties.description: Buque Museo Corbeta ARA Uruguay is a preserved corvette ship turned museum, berthed in Buenos Aires. This historical vessel, launched in 1874, offers visitors a glimpse into Argentina's naval history. It served in several key naval battles and is a prominent symbol of the country's maritime heritage. The museum features exhibits showcasing the ship's operational history, life aboard, and naval artifacts. Guests can explore various sections of the ship, including the bridge and crew quarters, and enjoy the scenic views of the Río de la Plata. This unique attraction highlights both military and cultural significance.

properties.name: Cabaña Las Lilas
properties.location:
Avenida Alicia Moreau de Justo 516
Buenos Aires, C1107AAL
Argentina
properties.description: Cabaña Las Lilas is a prestigious Argentine steakhouse located in the heart of Puerto Madero, Buenos Aires. Established in 1995, it is a joint venture between Belarmino Fernández Iglesias, owner of the renowned Rubaiyat restaurant in São Paulo, and Estancias y Cabaña Las Lilas S.A., a fourth-generation family business specializing in breeding premium livestock. The restaurant is celebrated for its exceptional grilled meats, including veal chitterlings, mixed offal, ribeye, and Summus Rubaiyat picanha, sourced from their own cattle. Its elegant setting overlooking the river adds to the dining experience. The extensive wine cellar complements the menu, and the option to order half portions for many dishes caters to diverse preferences. Cabaña Las Lilas has been recognized by The New York Times as one of the world's top 10 restaurants and has received the Wine Spectator award since 2007.
